results.title: 12th Tokyo Motor Show: 1965
results.brief_description: The annual Tokyo Motor Show displays the progress of the Japanese motor industry to the nation and visitors from overseas. A wide variety of vehicles are manufactured in Japan and this annual event creates great interest from business people and car enthusiasts. Planned by the Japan Motor Industrial Federation.

results.title: 12,000 men
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and Martin Duckworth
results.brief_description: This powerful documentary brings alive the brave story of Cape Breton’s union struggles in the coal and steel industries from the 1890s through the labour wars of the 1920s. The fight for decent wages and improved working conditions took on an urgency when the British Empire Steel Corporation, or BESCO, bought every single steel and coal company in Nova Scotia. When the Montreal-based company cut wages by a third, a long and bitter dispute began. The lockouts, picket lines and strikes were finally ended by brute force when provincial police and federal troops were sent in. The mine owners, however, were ultimately forced to recognize the union. This film combines vintage footage, photographs, drawings and interviews with men and women who were actually in the pits and on the front lines. These Cape Bretoners speak of the hardship and brief victories of the coal miners and their families. Photography by Martin Duckworth. Editing by Martin Duckworth and Shelagh Mackenzie. Sound by Patricia Kipping. Voice and narration by Kenzie MacNeil. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: 12 Angry men
results.creator_credit: Terence A. Donnelly, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: A young man is accused of fatally stabbing his father, and his fate now lies in the hands of his “peers”: 12 men from all walks of life, different backgrounds, who all bring their own agendas and prejudices with them. Is he innocent or guilty? Is there reasonable doubt? The tension mounts as each piece of evidence is examined again and again. This film provides the viewer with an insight into the American legal system and what may happen behind the scenes of any murder trial. This is an emotionally charged courtroom drama with a star studded cast including Courtney B Vance, Ossie Davis, George C Scott, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Dorian Harewood, James Gandolfini, Tony Danza, Jack Lemon, Hume Croyn, Mykelti Williamson, Edward James and Olmas William Peterson.

results.title: 11.59: last minute to choose
results.brief_description: A study of the social and psychological factors involved in drug abuse. Various sections of the drug culture are contrasted using split screen techniques. “11:59” brings you into the hospital emergency room, the teenagers are shown in frank discussion groups, exploring attitudes and seeking solutions. WARNING: Contains footage of drug use, overdose and emergency treatment in hospitals.

results.title: 11 09 01: September 11
results.creator_credit: Galatee Films, Studio Canal, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu
results.brief_description: Eleven renowned directors were given the brief to create a short films that in some way responded to the tragic events of September 11, 2001, when America was thrown into disarray by the terrorist attacks on, among other targets, the Twin Towers. The only proviso was that each film be eleven minutes, nine seconds and one frame long. The directors invited to participate were: Yussef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic, and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu. The results are very mixed — from the abstract to the obvious — and the overall piece did not meet with great acclaim. Regardless, the project has some insightful moments, in particular, the segments from Ken Loach, Mira Nair and Samira Makhmalbaf.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Galatee Films, Studio Canal, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu

results.title: 102 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Edward S. Feldman, Walt Disney Pictures and Kevin Lima
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Dodie Smith, and a sequel to Disney’s 1996 live-action adaptation of their animated classic, ‘101 Dalmatians’, this live-action film once again features Glenn Close in the role of the over-the-top and rather bizarre Cruella De Vil. After three years in prison Cruella is determined to keep away from animal fur - especially of the doggy kind - but it seems despite all her best intentions, Cruella unwittingly finds herself again embroiled in a ‘haute couture’ situation. Cast includes Ioan Gruffudd, Alice Evans, Tim McInnerny, Ian Richardson, Gerard Depardieu.

constellations_other.name: Femme fatales to fembots (PLACEHOLDER)
constellations_other.description:
When women gain power, men get scared. You can see this in the mysterious, seductive and deadly femme fatale. Using her sexuality and intellect to manipulate, control and co-opt power, the femme fatale reflects prevailing attitudes to women.

NOTE: Toll of the Sea and 102 Dalmations to be replaced with exhibition objects.

results.title: 101 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Great Oaks, Walt Disney Pictures, John Hughes, Ricardo Mestres and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: This live-action adapted version of Dodie Smith’s classic children’s story will delight and amaze the whole family. Cruella De Vil (Glenn Close) is a woman with a passionate obsession for fur coats. Her quest is to have a coat made from the skin of the sweet dalmation pups owned by Anita and her husband Roger. The pups are kidnapped by two bumbling henchmen and Pongo and Perdita, the pups’ parents, enlist a canine army to execute a daring rescue. The special effects are outstanding as are the performances by an excellent cast, particularly Glenn Close. Co-starring Joely Richardson, Jeff Daniels, Joan Plowright and Hugh Laurie.

results.title: 100% Parlants et Chantants (1930-1933) Pt. 02
results.brief_description:
Part 2 of a 13 part series on the history of French cinema. By 1930 it becomes clear that the ‘talkies’ are here to stay and all eyes are turned to the USA. American (RCA, Western Electric) and German (TobisKlangFilm) sound systems are quickly adopted, as well as the short-lived routine of filming several language versions of the same film with different sets of actors. Paramount sets up a studio in Joinville, other studios are buit in Epinay, Boulogne-Billancourt as well as in the South of France (Nice/La Victorine). The production level re-establishes itself around 100 to 120 films per year. Germany’s ‘The Blue Angel’ is the first sub-titled film released in Paris. With this film, talkies become all singing and dancing. The advent of the sound era is also a turning point for many careers. Many film actors must accept that their voice is unsuitable for the new medium, while many stage actors discover that their voice training can open the door to a new career. This is the case for Gaby Morlay and especially for Raimu, whose tonitruant voice can win over microphones that are neither sensitive nor directional. Among the stand-out films of this era are Gremillon’s ‘La petite Lise’ (1929), Rene Clair’s ‘Le Million’ (X000265) and ‘A nous la liberte’ (X000158). [*=held in our collection]

Credits: Director, Armand Panigel ; photography, Claude Casard.
Interviewees include: Rene Clair, Pierre Braunberger, Marcel L’Herbier, Yves Allegret, Henri-George Clouzot.

results.title: 100 Years of Victorian women's right to vote
results.creator_credit: Lisetta Moscardo, Helen Simondson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Australian women have long been at the forefront of political change and civic reform. Over the decades, women have fought for their beliefs; the right to vote, professional advancement; and equality under the law. Watch the inspirational stories of eight women who were all first in their respective fields in this biographical documentary project. Produced by ACMI in partnership with the Victorian Government, through the Office of Women’s Policy Department of Planning and Community Development as part of the 2008 Celebration of the Centenary of Women’s Vote.
